{"step_by_step_thinking": "The common carotid artery divides into the internal carotid artery (ICA) and the external carotid artery (ECA) at the level of the upper border of the thyroid cartilage. This is typically around the fourth cervical vertebra. The cricoid cartilage, 1st tracheal ring, and cricothyroid membrane are not the correct anatomical landmarks for this division.", "answer_choice": "B. Thyroid cartilage"}
